intro: Spiesia ajanensis, commonly known as the Ajanensis spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
